name: 'A Good Day' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the man that split the Nobel prize with President Bartlet?
questions.explanation:
Yosh Takahashi.

	Dr. Yosh Takahashi was portrayed by Mako. The President didn't think Doctor Takahashi was invited to the Nobel prize dinner, but CJ surprised him by saying not only was he invited, but he was waiting to see the President. During the dinner, Doctor Takahashi fell while dancing the Tango and had to be carried to the Oval Office.

questions.text: What was the name of the young man that Toby put in the press pool to ask the President a question during the President's press conference?
questions.explanation:
Cody Zucker.

	Toby told the President if he felt like it to call on a young man in the press pool. Cody was called on and he asked two questions about budget and how it would affect the children in the future.

questions.text:
Who said this and to whom?
"My office is your office."
questions.explanation:
Cliff to Josh.

	Josh and Santos used Cliff's office to discuss how they were going to gather the Democrats together so they could be ready for the vote and not let the Speaker know they were there.

questions.text: Where was the Congressman from that Cliff woke up in his office?
questions.explanation:
Arkansas.

	Cliff had heard rumors that the Congressman had been living in his office. He discovered the rumors were true when he found the Arkansas Congressman asleep in his office. Cliff found out that the Congressman couldn't afford a place to live in Washington D.C.

questions.text: Why did CJ let Toby take care of the Future Leaders for Democracy?
questions.correct: Because Toby was good with kids
options: It was her job, but she was too busy
Annabeth told CJ to let Toby have the kids
CJ thought Toby would scare them away
questions.explanation:
Because Toby was good with kids.

	Toby didn't want the kids so he pushed them off on Annabeth who gave them a tour of the White House. Finally, Toby sat down with the kids in the Roosevelt room and talked to them about a child's right to vote.

questions.text: Who referred to Donna as "Russell's chicken fighter"?
questions.explanation:
Santos.

	Santos was hiding out in the Vice President's room in the House waiting for the vote the next morning. When he sat down on the couch, he sat on Donna and she started screaming. After he got her calmed down, he called her "Russell's chicken fighter".

questions.text: What was the working title of the operation to infiltrate Canada?
questions.explanation:
Operation Northern Lights.

	While in the situation room, Kate found a file to infiltrate Canada with CIA ranchers and it was called Operation Northern Lights.

questions.text: What was the bill that Cliff tried to rally the Democrats together so he could get it passed?
options: Drought conditions in third world countries
questions.explanation:
Stemcell research.

	Speaker Haffley stalled the bill the first time when he saw the Democrats ready to vote for it.

questions.text: Kate put an end to the Canadian hostage situation by ending hunting season.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After Kate found out that a helicopter had landed in Canada, she told the man on the phone to find the nearest high ranking Canadian official, get a bullhorn, and tell him or her to end hunting season. Anyone that shoots a gun after hunting season is declared officially over, would be arrested.

questions.text: What game did Cliff tell CJ he played with the Speaker of the House on most mornings?
options: It wasn't the Speaker he played any games with
questions.explanation:
Squash.

	Cliff told CJ that he played squash with the Speaker in the mornings and that the day of the vote he beat him in all five games.
